message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.IT 

This paper discusses the use of IoT devices for communication in disaster scenarios, which falls under the category of network resilience. The paper specifically focuses on the technical aspects of implementing such a system, including network protocols and data traffic prioritization, which suggests that it belongs to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. However, the paper also touches on security concerns (cs.CR), system dynamics and control (cs.SY), distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC), and information theory (cs.IT) in the context of IoT-enabled communication during disasters. Therefore, these sub-categories are also likely to be relevant.
